channel.title: CVE Feed for pyload -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for pyload -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-0057|2024-08-02T04:54:32.656Z -- pyload -- pyload%2Fpyload
item.description: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev33.

item.description: Improper Input Validation in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev40.

item.title: CVE-2023-0055|2024-08-02T04:54:32.575Z -- pyload -- pyload%2Fpyload
item.description: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev32.

item.description: Improper Certificate Validation in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev44.

item.title: CVE-2023-0435|2024-08-02T05:10:56.243Z -- pyload -- pyload%2Fpyload
item.description: Excessive Attack Surface in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev41.

item.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev42.

item.title: CVE-2023-0297|2024-08-02T05:10:54.945Z -- pyload -- pyload%2Fpyload
item.description: Code Injection in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev31.

item.title: CVE-2023-0227|2024-08-02T05:02:43.912Z -- pyload -- pyload%2Fpyload
item.description: Insufficient Session Expiration in GitHub repository pyload/pyload prior to 0.5.0b3.dev36.

item.title: CVE-2024-24808|2024-02-06T03:17:16.532Z -- pyload -- pyload
item.description: pyLoad is an open-source Download Manager written in pure Python. There is an open redirect vulnerability due to incorrect validation of input values when redirecting users after login. pyLoad is validating URLs via the `get_redirect_url` function when redirecting users at login. This vulnerability has been patched with commit fe94451.

item.title: CVE-2024-32880|2024-06-04T17:51:11.607Z -- pyload -- pyload
item.description: pyload is an open-source Download Manager written in pure Python. An authenticated user can change the download folder and upload a crafted template to the specified folder lead to remote code execution. There is no fix available at the time of publication.

item.title: CVE-2024-32880|2024-08-02T02:20:35.649Z -- pyload -- pyload
item.description: pyload is an open-source Download Manager written in pure Python. An authenticated user can change the download folder and upload a crafted template to the specified folder lead to remote code execution. There is no fix available at the time of publication.
